body_html:
Can you add a comment to http://pytorch.org/docs/master/notes/multiprocessing.html about torch.set_num_threads? I was trying to do hogwild training, and if I had an nn.Module subclass which was loaded from file, without setting torch.set_num_threads(1) softmax was causing a deadlock every single time (even with only two threads).
For some reason this didn't happen when the model was initialized from scratch.

body:
Can you add a comment to http://pytorch.org/docs/master/notes/multiprocessing.html about `torch.set_num_threads`? I was trying to do hogwild training, and if I had an nn.Module subclass which was loaded from file, without setting `torch.set_num_threads(1)` softmax was causing a deadlock every single time (even with only two threads).
For some reason this didn't happen when the model was initialized from scratch.
